newsitem.title: HONG KONG: First Pacific down after earnings report.
newsitem.headline: First Pacific down after earnings report.

text.p: Shares of First Pacific Ltd fell further in afternoon trade after the company posted interim earnings of US$90.8 million compared with US$129.1 million a year earlier.
"The earnings were in line with expectations and investors took profits when they saw no surprise from the earnings," said Joyce Leung, sales manager from Sun Hung Kai Securities.

The shares fell HK$0.35, or 2.79 percent, to an intraday low of HK$12.20 before steadying at HK$12.30. Volume was 1.84 million shares worth HK$22.78 million. Brokers said they expected the shares to find support in the short run since analysts were optimistic about First Pacific's earnings outlook. First Pacific also raised its interim dividend payout to 1.16 US cents from 0.96 cents.

"The shares are likely to edge up again after they gain sufficient momentum to rise again," said one dealing director at a regional brokerage. "Its interim earnings were actually up if you exclude the exceptional."
